date: 2025-01-07
---

## GAD-7 vs PSS

Psychologists and researchers often grapple with the daunting task of comparing psychological measures such as the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Perceived Stress Scale (PSS). The comparison or harmonisation process allows psychologists to draw significant insights from different studies or questionnaires. However, it is often time-consuming, tedious, and subjective. Enter: Harmony, a revolutionary software designed to dramatically simplify the GAD-7 vs PSS comparison process using the power of artificial intelligence and natural language processing. In the world of psychology, research, and social sciences, the GAD-7 vs PSS comparison is not uncommon. However, sifting through extensive questionnaires and manually comparing each item is a herculean task. Harmony, with its robust natural language processing and generative AI models, enables researchers to quickly harmonize questionnaire items, even across different languages. It draws upon large language models to offer a percentage match between each item in GAD-7 and PSS, thereby providing a seamless and objective comparison between the two scales. Opt for Harmony for all your GAD-7 vs PSS comparison needs and embark on a smarter, more efficient journey of drawing meaningful correlations from different studies. With Harmony, you can select instruments from the built-in database or upload your own PDF questionnaires for the software to process. With a simple drag and drop interface, Harmony makes it incredibly easy and enjoyable to perform harmonisation tasks, bringing unprecedented efficiency and objectivity to the process. Make GAD-7 vs PSS comparisons a breeze with Harmony, and focus on what truly matters - the exploration and application of human behaviour and emotions.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
